page.title: 13 Grubbing Out.
page.content: We saw 4 men tramping along a track across what looked like a badly ploughed field, picking up what looked like giant parsnips.We spoke to them later. They were grubbing out an orchard of Bramley cooking apples. After about 60 years a Bramley orchard is grubbed out and left fallow for 12 months.Then a winter wheat is cultivated.The following year,with the soil recovered and old roots rotted to avoid root diseases,the next crop of young trees is planted. Eating apple orchards are grubbed out after only 20 years.The men doing the grubbing were contracted by Arnold Fruit Farms to carry out grubbing as it would be uneconomic for even large farms to own their own bulldozers and grubbing machinery. Grubbing ends in summer when contract workers turn to harvesting with specialist machinery.
